title: Using Projects for Persistent Context
description: Learn to use Claude's Projects feature to maintain context across conversations, organize your work, and build more complex applications efficiently.
learningObjectives: Understand what Projects are and when to use them
Set up a Project with custom instructions and knowledge base
Maintain context across multiple conversations within a Project
Organize multiple features or iterations efficiently using Projects

videos.description: Shows how to use Projects to iterate across sessions without losing context.

textSections.title: Custom Instructions Template
textSections.content:
Use this template for your Project's custom instructions:

---

**Project Overview:**
[Brief description of what you're building]

**Tech Stack:**
- Frontend: [e.g., Next.js 14, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS]
- Backend: [e.g., Supabase, tRPC]
- Deployment: [e.g., Vercel]
- Other tools: [e.g., Stripe for payments]

**Code Style:**
- [e.g., 'Use functional components in React']
- [e.g., 'Prefer named exports over default exports']
- [e.g., 'Add TypeScript types for all functions']

**Project Constraints:**
- [e.g., 'Must work on mobile browsers']
- [e.g., 'Keep bundle size under 500KB']
- [e.g., 'No external API dependencies unless approved']

**When generating code:**
- Explain what each file does before showing code
- Include error handling and loading states
- Write comments for complex logic
- Suggest testing approach for new features

**Current Status:**
[e.g., 'MVP deployed, working on v2 features']
[Update this as you progress]

---

Example for 02Ship:

**Project Overview:**
A learning platform teaching non-programmers to build products with Claude AI.

**Tech Stack:**
- Frontend: Next.js 14 (App Router), TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
- Content: MDX (blog), JSON (courses)
- Deployment: Vercel
- Analytics: Vercel Analytics

**Code Style:**
- Use TypeScript strict mode
- Prefer named exports
- Mobile-first responsive design
- WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility

**Project Constraints:**
- All content must be beginner-friendly
- No authentication required initially
- Fast page loads (< 2s LCP)

**When generating code:**
- Explain file structure first
- Include accessibility attributes (ARIA)
- Suggest SEO improvements where relevant
- Keep components small and focused

**Current Status:**
MVP live, building out course content and progress tracking.

textSections.title: What to Upload as Knowledge Files
textSections.content:
**Essential files to upload:**

1. **README.md** - Project overview and setup instructions
2. **Requirements/Specs** - Your original project brief or PRD
3. **Design Files** - Wireframes, Figma exports (as PDFs), or design system docs
4. **API Documentation** - If integrating with external services
5. **Database Schema** - Your data model (ERD or schema file)

**Optional but helpful:**

- Package.json - Dependencies and scripts
- Existing code samples - So Claude matches your style
- Brand guidelines - Tone, voice, color palette
- User research - Pain points, quotes, personas

**File format tips:**

- Markdown (.md) works best
- PDFs for complex docs
- Code files (.ts, .tsx, .json) for technical references
- Keep individual files under 10MB
- Total knowledge base: up to 100MB per Project

**Don't upload:**

- Entire codebases (too large, use git repo instead)
- Secrets or API keys (use environment variables)
- Binary files (images, videos) unless necessary for context

textSections.title: Projects vs. Regular Chats: When to Use Each
textSections.content:
**Use Projects when:**

- Building a specific product/app over days/weeks
- You have technical requirements that should persist (tech stack, style guides)
- You're iterating on the same codebase across multiple sessions
- You need Claude to reference specific docs/files repeatedly
- Working on a team (share Project access with collaborators)

**Use Regular Chats when:**

- Quick one-off questions ('How do I deploy to Vercel?')
- Exploring ideas before committing to a project
- Learning/research without building
- Testing different approaches before choosing one
- General productivity tasks unrelated to a specific build

**Pro tip:** Start with regular chats to explore, then create a Project once you're committed to building.

**Organization strategy:**

- **Main Project:** Your core product (e.g., '02Ship Platform')
- **Feature Projects:** Major features that need dedicated focus (e.g., '02Ship - User Auth System')
- **Experiment Projects:** Test ideas before integrating (e.g., '02Ship - AI Course Generator POC')

Archive completed Projects to keep your workspace clean.

textSections.title: Organizing Conversations Within Projects
textSections.content:
**Conversation naming strategy:**

✅ Good:
- 'Build user profile page'
- 'Debug payment integration'
- 'Add dark mode feature'
- 'Refactor course data structure'

❌ Bad:
- 'Help' (too vague)
- 'Untitled conversation' (default — rename it!)
- 'Fix stuff' (unclear what stuff)

**When to start a new conversation:**

- Beginning a new feature or major task
- Previous conversation got too long (>50 messages)
- Switching to a different part of the codebase
- Starting a new sprint/phase

**When to continue existing conversation:**

- Iterating on the same feature
- Debugging issues from the same session
- Following up on previous questions

**Conversation cleanup:**

- Archive conversations once features ship
- Delete test/throwaway conversations
- Keep important decision conversations for reference

**Reference previous conversations:**

'In our conversation about the login system, you suggested...' — Claude can reference it!

textSections.title: Key Definitions
textSections.content:
**Project (Claude):** A workspace with persistent custom instructions, knowledge files, and conversation history

**Custom Instructions:** Persistent guidelines Claude follows in every conversation within a Project

**Knowledge Base:** Files you upload to a Project that Claude can reference

**Conversation History:** All previous chats within a Project that Claude remembers

**Context Window:** The amount of text Claude can process at once (Projects help manage this)

**Artifact:** Code or documents Claude generates (visible in all Project conversations)

commonMistakes.mistake: Using one Project for multiple unrelated products
commonMistakes.explanation: Keep Projects focused — one Project per product. Otherwise context gets muddled.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not updating custom instructions as requirements change
commonMistakes.explanation: Review and update instructions regularly. Outdated instructions lead to wrong outputs.

commonMistakes.mistake: Uploading your entire codebase as knowledge files
commonMistakes.explanation: Too much information overwhelms Claude. Upload key docs and references only.

commonMistakes.mistake: Starting new Projects for every small feature
commonMistakes.explanation: Use conversations within one Project for features. Reserve new Projects for major initiatives.
Future you (and Claude) won't remember what 'Untitled conversation 12' was about.

reflectionQuestions: Think about your current project: what context do you find yourself repeating to Claude every time?
What files or documents would be most helpful for Claude to have permanent access to?
How would your workflow change if Claude remembered everything about your project across sessions?

instructorNotes: This lesson requires Claude Pro — confirm learners have access or offer trial suggestions.
For live sessions: Do a screen share showing Project setup step-by-step. Common confusion: where to find the Projects tab.
Common question: 'Can I share Projects with teammates?' — Yes! Great for pair building.
Self-paced tip: Encourage learners to migrate their existing work into a Project to feel the immediate benefit.
Time check: Exercise 2 can run long if the feature is complex — suggest keeping it simple (e.g., add a button).
Bonus: Show your own 02Ship Project setup as a real-world example.
Meta moment: Point out that organizing Projects is like organizing your workspace — invest time upfront, save time later.
